properties.areaDesc: North Central; Central Interior; Ponce and Vicinity; Northwest; Western Interior; Mayaguez and Vicinity
properties.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:44PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
At 240 PM AST, strong thunderstorms were over and near Isabela,
Rincon and Aguadilla, moving eastward at 15 to 20 mph.

HAZARD...40 to 50 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and
heavy rain.

SOURCE...Radar indicated.

IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of
light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary
street flooding especially in poor drainage areas.
properties.instruction:
People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear
thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists
should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to
hydroplaning.

NWSheadline: A line with strong thunderstorms will impact portions of western, and northwestern Puerto Rico, from Rincon to Aguadilla eastward into the western interior through 415 PM AST

properties.areaDesc: Adjuntas, PR; Lares, PR; Maricao, PR; Utuado, PR
properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 25 at 2:41PM AST until August 25 at 5:45PM AST by NWS San Juan PR
properties.description:
* WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.

* WHERE...A portion of Puerto Rico, including the following
counties, Adjuntas, Lares, Maricao and Utuado.

* WHEN...Until 545 PM AST.

* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas.
Water over roadways.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...
- At 241 PM AST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to
thunderstorms which continue to develop and move across these
areas. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly
in the advisory area. Up to 1 inch of rain has fallen.
- Additional rainfall amounts up to 1 inch are expected over
the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
- Some locations that will experience flooding include...
Adjuntas, Utuado, Lares, Maricao and Cayuco.
- http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.Be aware of your surroundings and do not
drive on flooded roads.In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low
water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do
not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.

NWSheadline: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM AST THIS AFTERNOON

title: Current watches, warnings, and advisories for Puerto Rico
